content: By: Tasmin Lofthouse March 11, 2024 How to Make AI Your Writing Sidekick for Content Marketing Content Marketing | Blogging | AI and SEO Tasmin shares her tips on how to make AI your content marketing sidekick. Optimize every step of the process, from generating ideas to crafting headlines and simplifying your writing. Read this post By: Dani Leitner December 4, 2023 How a Small Travel Blog Gained Topical Authority: A Case Study Blogging | Content Marketing | Keyword Research Explore the journey of a small travel blog's rise to topical authority in this case study. Read this post By: Molly Ploe September 11, 2023 Author names: Do They Matter? How to Attribute Content Content Marketing | Blogging Learn about the importance of author attribution in content creation and SEO. Discover when and why to attribute content to authors, and gain insights from Google's perspective. Read this post By: Ann Smarty January 16, 2023 How to Align Your Blog with Your Organic Search Conversion Funnel Blogging | Content Marketing Business blogging is a good way to achieve “accidental rankings” (those you didn’t necessarily plan for) and discover more search-driven sales channels. And yet, many business owners or marketing managers have no idea what their blogs are ranking for. Consequently, there’s no buying journey set up for anyone who lands on a blog post. Clicks may come, but a blog remains an island. So, how can you include your blog in your overall marketing strategy? See what made the cut for most popular, and read the best posts you may have missed! Read this post By: Morgan McMurray December 17, 2020 What's Changed and What Hasn't: The 2020 Moz Blog Reader Survey Results Blogging | Marketing Industry | Moz News In the last three years, our industry and our world have seen massive shifts. Here are our top takeaways from the 2020 Moz Blog Reader Survey. Read this post By: Liam Barnes September 22, 2020 How to Turn One Piece of Content into Multiple for SEO Blogging | Content Marketing | Social Media As people consume more and more content each day, they become less receptive to basic content that doesn't provide a new perspective. To counter this issue, you must make sure that your content is native to each platform you publish on. However, that doesn’t mean that you need to start from scratch. There's a way to take one content idea and turn it into multiple, which can scale across multiple platforms and improve your brand awareness. Read this post By: Daisy Quaker July 21, 2020 Blog Topics: How to Find Your Sweet Spot (Even in a Boring Niche) Blogging | Content Marketing If you’re going to put your time into creating and promoting a blog post, and hope to get results, you owe it to yourself to figure out what you’re best suited to blog about. Read this post By: Amanda Milligan June 15, 2020 How-To Content Isn’t Going Anywhere (and What That Means for Your Strategy) Blogging | Content Marketing How-tos not only lend themselves to the thrill of learning new information online, they also serve as a tool of empowerment. If people continue to desire this type of content, how can you make sure you’re incorporating it into your content plans accordingly? See what made the cut for most popular and read the best posts you may have missed! Read this post By: Daisy Quaker October 7, 2019 How We Grew Blog Traffic by 650% in Two Years — Organically Content Marketing | Advanced SEO | Blogging Content marketing isn't easy when your industry's topics are dry. Here are the eight tactics one digital marketer used to triple blog growth for an e-commerce and manufacturing company in two years. Read this post By: Kameron Jenkins August 28, 2019 How to Use Keywords in Your Blogging Strategy Keyword Research | SEO Basics | Blogging [Using Keywords In Blog] If you're an established blogger new to SEO, you'll benefit from this primer on how keyword research can help your BLOG show up on Google and get in front of readers who'll care about your content. Read this post By: Laurel Taylor November 26, 2018 What to Do with Your Old Blog Posts Content Marketing | Blogging Fallout from the days of mandatory blogging means that many of us have a ton of old content on the sites we manage. What's the best way to decide which posts to keep, which to repurpose, and which to get rid of altogether?
